title: Rashida Tlaib
added: In May 2019, on the [[yahoo podcast]] skullduggery, Tlaib said the [[Holocaust]] had a calming effect on her because “it was my ancestors, Palestinians, who lost their land, and some lost their lives, their livelihood, their human dignity; their existence in some ways had been wiped out … all of it was in the name of trying to create a safe haven for Jews, post the Holocaust, post the tragedy and horrific persecution of Jews across the world at that time.” “[I am] humbled by the fact that it was [my] ancestors that had to suffer for that to happen.” This statement was dismissed by historian [[Benny Morris]] who said that the [[Palestinians]] contributed to the [[Holocaust]] by refusing Jewish Immigration to [[Palestine]] prior to the [[Second World War]] and the actions of [[Amin al-Husseini]], who during the war helped to recruit Muslim volunteers for the [[SS]] and the [[Wehrmacht]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/05/rashida-tlaib-misled-skullduggery-listeners-israel/589417/|title=Rashida Tlaib Has Her History Wrong|last=Morris|first=Benny|date=2019-05-14 |work=The Atlantic}}</ref>

title: Rashida Tlaib
added: In May 2019, on the [[yahoo podcast]] skullduggery, Tlaib said the [[Holocaust]] had a calming effect on her because “it was my ancestors, Palestinians, who lost their land, and some lost their lives, their livelihood, their human dignity; their existence in some ways had been wiped out … all of it was in the name of trying to create a safe haven for Jews, post the[[Holocaust]], post the tragedy and horrific persecution of Jews across the world at that time.” “[I am] humbled by the fact that it was [my] ancestors that had to suffer for that to happen.” This statement was dismissed by historian [[Benny Morris]] who said that the [[Palestinians]] contributed to the [[Holocaust]] by refusing Jewish Immigration to [[Palestine]] prior to the [[Second World War]] and the actions of [[Amin al-Husseini]], who during the war helped to recruit Muslim volunteers for the [[SS]] and the [[Wehrmacht]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/05/rashida-tlaib-misled-skullduggery-listeners-israel/589417/|title=Rashida Tlaib Has Her History Wrong|last=Morris|first=Benny|date=2019-05-14 |work=The Atlantic}}</ref>

title: Rashida Tlaib
added: In May 2019, on the [[yahoo podcast]] skullduggery, Tlaib said the [[Holocaust]] had a calming effect on her because “it was my ancestors, Palestinians, who lost their land, and some lost their lives, their livelihood, their human dignity; their existence in some ways had been wiped out … all of it was in the name of trying to create a safe haven for Jews, post the [[Holocaust]], post the tragedy and horrific persecution of Jews across the world at that time.” “[I am] humbled by the fact that it was [my] ancestors that had to suffer for that to happen.” This statement was dismissed by historian [[Benny Morris]] who said that the [[Palestinians]] contributed to the [[Holocaust]] by refusing Jewish Immigration to [[MandatoryPalestine]] prior to the [[Second World War]] and the actions of [[Amin al-Husseini]], who during the war helped to recruit Muslim volunteers for the [[SS]] and the [[Wehrmacht]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/05/rashida-tlaib-misled-skullduggery-listeners-israel/589417/|title=Rashida Tlaib Has Her History Wrong|last=Morris|first=Benny|date=2019-05-14 |work=The Atlantic}}</ref>
